contexts.context: ...holding him from behind, and the risk of staining one's <mark>clothes</mark> with blood is practically nonexistant.
...neck-hackers I know generally carry a bit of wadded <mark>cloth</mark> on the aft-side of their knives to keep blood...
The next step is to wrap the servant in <mark>cloth</mark> or linen. This will further preserve the body against decay...
...or his village. So the Lord Vivec removed his fine <mark>clothes</mark> and toiled in the fields like a beast of burden until...
